alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 11:46AM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Flooding begins on Customs Road near mile post 6. At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Friday morning. Further rises are forecast through the weekend. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Kettle River Ferry above Curlew 18.5 16.8 Tue 10 am PD 17.4 18.1 18.5 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1215 PM PDT.
